member.name: E:DataStreams.Common.DataReaderBase.ReadRecord
member.summary: This event is raised after each record has been read and before the values have been converted to the destination type. This event can be used to modify values in a record, add values to a record, or skip a record entirely.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.TrimWhitespace
member.summary: Whether to trim leading and trailing whitespace characters from non-textqualified column data. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.Delimiter
member.summary: The character to use as the column delimiter. Default is comma, ','.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.RecordDelimiter
member.summary: The character to use as the record delimiter. Default is combination of standard end of line characters for Windows, Unix, or Mac.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.TextQualifier
member.summary: The character to use as a text qualifier in the data. Default is quote, '"'.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.UseTextQualifier
member.summary: Whether to use a text qualifier while parsing or not. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.Comment
member.summary: The character to use as a comment signal. Default is pound, '#'.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.UseComments
member.summary: Whether to look for comments while parsing or not. Default is false.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.EscapeMode
member.summary: Specifies how to escape an occurance of system characters, like the and , inside field values when required. Default is .
member.remarks:
When the is set to , occurances of the will be expected to be escaped by replacing it with two consecutive occurances of the . This is the format generally used for CSV in applications such as Excel. When the is set to , occurances of the will be expected to be escaped by preceding it with a backslash character. This format is common in Unix type environments. When the is set to , the following escape sequences are also recognized and replaced inside field values.
Escape Description
\n New Line, ASCII 10
\r Carriage Return, ASCII 13
\t Tab, ASCII 9
\b Backspace, ASCII 8
\f Form Feed, ASCII 12
\e Escape, ASCII 27
\v Vertical Tab, ASCII 11
\a Alert, ASCII 7
Format Description
\u#### or \U### Unicode, ex. \u0041 = 'A'
\x## or \X## Hexadecimal, ex. \x41 = 'A'
\o### or \O### or \### Octal, ex. \o101 = 'A'
\d### or \D### Decimal, ex. \d065 = 'A'

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.SkipEmptyRecords
member.summary: Whether to treat a record with no data as if it wasn't there or not. When set to true, two consecutive occurances of the record delimiter will be treated as only one. When set to true, when the reader encounters an empty record, all fields will contain their corresponding column's default value. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvDataReader.UserSettings.SafetySwitch
member.summary: Safety caution to prevent the parser from using large amounts of memory in the case where parsing settings like file encodings don't end up matching the actual format of a file. This switch can be turned off if the file format is known and tested. With the switch off, the max column lengths and max column count per record supported by the parser will greatly increase. Default is true.

\n New Line, ASCII 10
\r Carriage Return, ASCII 13
\t Tab, ASCII 9
\b Backspace, ASCII 8
\f Form Feed, ASCII 12
\e Escape, ASCII 27
\v Vertical Tab, ASCII 11
\a Alert, ASCII 7
Format Description
\u#### or \U### Unicode, ex. \u0041 = 'A'
\x## or \X## Hexadecimal, ex. \x41 = 'A'
\o### or \O### or \### Octal, ex. \o101 = 'A'
\d### or \D### Decimal, ex. \d065 = 'A'

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvReader.UserSettings.SafetySwitch
member.summary: Safety caution to prevent the parser from using large amounts of memory in the case where parsing settings like file encodings don't end up matching the actual format of a file. This switch can be turned off if the file format is known and tested. With the switch off, the max column lengths and max column count per record supported by the parser will greatly increase. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvReader.UserSettings.SkipEmptyRecords
member.summary: Whether to treat a record with no data as if it wasn't there or not. When set to true, two consecutive occurances of the record delimiter will be treated as only one. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvReader.UserSettings.CaptureRawRecord
member.summary: Determines whether the unparsed record text, , should be preserved while parsing. Slightly better performce can be obtained by setting this to false when the record text will not be used. Default is true.

member.summary: A stream based writer for writing delimited text data to a file or a stream.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.Settings
member.summary: Has all the options that are able to be set that will affect the way records are written.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.TextQualifier
member.summary: The character to use as a text qualifier in the data. Default is quote, '"'.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.UseTextQualifier
member.summary: Whether to qualify columns of data with the if the data requires it. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.Delimiter
member.summary: The character to use as the column delimiter. Default is comma, ','.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.RecordDelimiter
member.summary: The character to use as the record delimiter. Default uses the system default end of line marker.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.Comment
member.summary: The character to use as a comment signal. Default is pound, '#'.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.EscapeMode
member.summary: Specifies how to escape an occurance of system characters, like the and , inside field values when required. Default is .
member.remarks: When the is set to , occurances of the will be expected to be escaped by replacing it with two consecutive occurances of the . This is the format generally used for CSV in applications such as Excel. When the is set to , occurances of the will be expected to be escaped by preceding it with a backslash character. This format is common in Unix type environments.

member.name: P:DataStreams.Csv.CsvWriter.UserSettings.ForceQualifier
member.summary: Use this to force all fields to be surrounded by the text qualifier even if the qualifier is not necessarily needed to escape this field. Default is false.

member.name: T:DataStreams.Csv.EscapeMode
member.summary: How to escape an occurance of the text qualifier inside text qualified data.

member.name: F:DataStreams.Csv.EscapeMode.Doubled
member.summary: Double up the text qualifier to represent an occurance of the text qualifier.

member.name: F:DataStreams.Csv.EscapeMode.Backslash
member.summary: Use a backslash character before the text qualifier to represent an occurance of the text qualifier.

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthDataReader.Column.Alignment
member.summary: The justification of text in the column. If the text is left justified, then padding will be applied to the right side of the text to meet the column's defined width.

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthDataReader.Column.PaddingChar
member.summary: The character to use for padding a column's text to meet the defined column length. Spaces or zeros are the most common. Default is space.

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthDataReader.Column.TrimPadding
member.summary: Determines if padding characters should be removed from the text value of the column while parsing. Default is true.

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthDataReader.Column.MinLength
member.summary: When trimming off extra padding characters, the minimum length to return for this column. If the padding character is a zero, the minimum length might need to be set to 1.

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthWriter.Column.Alignment

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthWriter.Column.PaddingChar

member.name: P:DataStreams.FixedWidth.FixedWidthWriter.UserSettings.UseRecordDelimiter
member.summary: Determines if each record that is written will have normal end of line characters or custom delimiters that signify the end of a record. Since a fixed width file has a specific length to each record, a record delimiter may not be required. Default is true.

member.name: F:DataStreams.FixedWidth.TextAlignment.Left
member.summary: Text will be left justified and padding characters will be used on the right side of the text if needed to extend the column's length to the defined length.

member.name: F:DataStreams.FixedWidth.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: Text will be right justified and padding characters will be used on the left side of the text if needed to extend the column's length to the defined length.
